name: Cauliflower in Double Onion Sauce
description: Gobi Do Pyaza  - try this popular Indian Do pyaaza - double onion sauce made with pan-fried cauliflower florets simmered in a creamy and delicious onion sauce. Gluten-free, soy-free, nut-free option. Serve this gobi curry with rice or bread.
recipeIngredient: 1 head  cauliflower  (chopped into florets about 4 cups)
1/2 teaspoon cayenne or Indian Red Chili Powder
1 tablespoon tomato paste  (or 1/4 cup canned tomato puree or you can also use fresh)
1/2 cup non-dairy yogurt (or use cashew cream or 1cup coconut milk )
1/2 teaspoon crushed coriander seeds ((use ground coriander if you don’t like crushed seeds))
1/2  hot green chili finely chopped (or use mild Anaheim or other )

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Once hot, add your cauliflower florets and cook for 8-10 minutes until some of the edges of the cauliflower are golden brown. Cover after the first 4 mins.
recipeInstructions.name: Once hot, add your cauliflower florets and cook for 8-10 minutes until some of the edges of the cauliflower are golden brown. Cover after the first 4 mins.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the cauliflower from the skillet. Add the oil for the sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the cauliflower from the skillet. Add the oil for the sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the oil is hot, add in cumin seeds, bay leaves, cardamom, clove, and fenugreek leaves. Cook until the cumin seeds are fragrant and have changed in color.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the oil is hot, add in cumin seeds, bay leaves, cardamom, clove, and fenugreek leaves. Cook until the cumin seeds are fragrant and have changed in color.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in onion and a good pinch of salt. Mix well and cook until the onion is golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add in onion and a good pinch of salt. Mix well and cook until the onion is golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in the ground spices, garlic and ginger and mix well. Continue to cook for 2-3 minutes. If at any point, the mixture starts to stick or burn, add in a few splashes of water to deglaze.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add in the ground spices, garlic and ginger and mix well. Continue to cook for 2-3 minutes. If at any point, the mixture starts to stick or burn, add in a few splashes of water to deglaze.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in the tomato paste and mix in. If you're using fresh tomato puree, you want to cook it here for 2-3 minutes before going to the next step.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add in the tomato paste and mix in. If you're using fresh tomato puree, you want to cook it here for 2-3 minutes before going to the next step.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in the yogurt, salt, and mix in and bring to a boil. Add in 1 cup of water and the golden cauliflower.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add in the yogurt, salt, and mix in and bring to a boil. Add in 1 cup of water and the golden cauliflower.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix really well, cover, and cook over medium heat until the cauliflower is tender to preference. This will take about 7-10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix really well, cover, and cook over medium heat until the cauliflower is tender to preference. This will take about 7-10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, make your tempering.  Heat the oil in a small skillet. When hot, Add in the crushed coriander seeds and green chili and cook until the green chili starts to turn golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, make your tempering.  Heat the oil in a small skillet. When hot, Add in the crushed coriander seeds and green chili and cook until the green chili starts to turn golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in the onion and add a pinch of salt and mix well. Continue to cook until the onion is golden. Top the cauliflower curry with this tempering before serving
recipeInstructions.name: Then add in the onion and add a pinch of salt and mix well. Continue to cook until the onion is golden. Top the cauliflower curry with this tempering before serving

recipeInstructions.text: Also before serving, remove the bay leaves, clove, and cardamom if you can find them. Serve with Naan flatbreads, pita bread, rotis, or rice.
